content: When it comes to driving while under the influence of marijuana, states that have enacted legalization are seeing less of the potentially dangerous behavior than states that continue criminalization, according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Legalization Tied To ‘Significant Reductions’ In Prescription Drug Use, Researchers Find
content: Legalizing marijuana for adult use is associated with decreased use of prescription drugs for the treatment of conditions such as anxiety, sleep, pain and seizures, according to a new research paper.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Marijuana Legalization Tied To Significant Decrease In Foster Care Placements, New Study Finds
content: Legalizing marijuana for adult use is associated with at least a 10 percent decrease in foster care admissions on average, according to a new study, including reductions in placements due to physical abuse, neglect, parental incarceration and misuse of alcohol and other drugs.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Feeding Cows Hemp Helps Them Chill Out, Federally Funded Study Finds
content: Compared to the control group, the hemp-munching steers spent more time lying down and had lower levels of stress hormones.
author: Marijuana Moment

title: College Students Who Use Marijuana Show Signs Of Greater Motivation Compared To Non-Users, Study Finds
content: Researchers are again challenging the idea that people who smoke marijuana lack motivation, with a recent study suggesting that the opposite may be true.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Top Federal Drug Agency Funds Research On Differing Legal Marijuana Regulatory Models
content: The National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) is renewing its push to promote federally funded research into marijuana as more states enact reform—specifically expressing interest in studies on differing cannabis regulatory models that are in place across the country.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Don’t Feed Marijuana Buds To Donkeys, New Study Warns
content: Feeding donkeys fresh marijuana buds is inadvisable, according to a new study that looked at novel cases of cannabis toxicosis in two equine.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Banking Activity Increases In States That Legalize Marijuana, Study Finds
content: While marijuana businesses often struggle to find banks that are willing to take them on as clients due to risks caused by the ongoing federal prohibition of cannabis, a new study found that banking activity actually increases in states that legalize marijuana.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Young People Who Use Marijuana Have Better Orgasms and Sexual Function, Study Says
content: Young people who smoke marijuana and drink alcohol have better orgasms and overall sexual function than their peers who abstain or use less, a study in Spain recently concluded.
author: Dan Goldman

title: One-Third Of Programmers Use Marijuana While Working, With Many Touting Creative Benefits, Study Finds
content: More than one-third of software programmers say they’ve used marijuana while working, with many finding that it helps promote creativity and get them into the “programming zone,” according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Young People Who Use Marijuana Have Better Orgasms and Sexual Function, Study Says
content: Young people who smoke marijuana and drink alcohol have better orgasms and overall sexual function than their peers who abstain or use less, a study in Spain recently concluded.
author: Dan Goldman

title: One-Third Of Programmers Use Marijuana While Working, With Many Touting Creative Benefits, Study Finds
content: More than one-third of software programmers say they’ve used marijuana while working, with many finding that it helps promote creativity and get them into the “programming zone,” according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Researcher Uses Reddit To Learn What Kinds Of Marijuana Posts Influenced Legalization Attitudes
content: Social media is a powerful tool in shaping political discourse, and a recent study that examined Reddit posts spanning over a decade sheds light on exactly what kinds of conversations may have influenced the public’s shift in support of marijuana legalization.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Smoking CBD-Rich Marijuana Has ‘No Significant Impact’ On Driving Ability, Study Finds
content: A new study found “no significant impact” on driving ability after smoking CBD-rich marijuana and no effects on vital signs, even as all the study participants exceeded the legal limit for THC in their blood.
author: Dan Goldman

title: Youth Marijuana Use ‘Decreased Significantly’ In 2021 Despite State Reforms, Federally Funded Survey Finds
content: Youth marijuana use “decreased significantly” in 2021, as did teen consumption of illicit substances overall, according to a federally funded survey that was released on Wednesday. That’s despite the fact that more state cannabis legalization laws are being enacted and implemented across the country.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Allowing Legal Marijuana Dispensaries Boosts Employment Rates In Colorado Counties, Study Finds
content: The legalization of adult-use marijuana in Colorado increased jobs and did not negatively impact worker productivity, according to a new study based on eight years of data from the state.
author: Dan Goldman

title: Marijuana Helps Treat PTSD Symptoms But Federal Policy Impedes Science, VA Researcher Says
content: People with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) who use marijuana experience fewer symptoms and recover more quickly compared to people who don’t use cannabis, a U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs researcher said in a new podcast posted by the agency.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: DEA Backs White House Plan To Streamline Research On Marijuana, Psychedelics And Other Schedule I Drugs
content: The Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) and National Institute On Drug Abuse (NIDA) say they are in favor of a White House proposal to streamline the process of researching Schedule I drugs like marijuana and certain psychedelics.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Top Federal Drug Official Says There’s ‘No Evidence’ That Occasional Marijuana Use Is Harmful For Adults
content: The head of the nation’s top federal drug research agency says that she’s yet to see evidence that occasional marijuana use by adults is harmful.
author: Kyle Jaeger

title: Dogs Are Being Exposed To Marijuana Through Human Poop And Pet Owners Should Beware, Study Finds
content: A word of caution to dog owners: apparently some canines are getting intoxicated off marijuana by eating the feces of people who’ve consumed cannabis, according to a new study.
author: Kyle Jaeger
